On May 22, 2009, at 12:08 AM, Bill Burke wrote:
>
> I've been trying to kill WADL in RESTEasy as well.  I totally agree  
> that
> an XSD and/or human documentation should be sufficient.  People want  
> it
> though.  They want to be able to generate client stubs so that they
> don't have to hand-code HTTP requests.  You know all the  
> arguments.... :(

Something like WADL makes sense as a model (and source for code  
generation) for implementing the server component. Providing it as an  
API description is 'dangerous', IMHO, as it creates an impression of  
stability (of the interface) that REST is actually trying to avoid.  
All the client has to know should be in the media type specification.

If the scope and expected stability of the media type makes developers  
feel they need code generation - maybe that is a hint that the media  
type is too narrowly defined?

Though, I also know all the argumets :-)
